N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1001.3 - Applications for and the inspection and copying of records

State Regulations

An application to inspect or to copy information
constituting records under this Part shall be made to the secretary. Such
application shall be made in writing either by letter or on a form provided by
the authority and shall reasonably describe the record sought. Such description
shall, when possible, include information regarding dates, file designations
and such other information that may assist in describing the record sought. Within five business days following receipt of such application, if the
secretary determines that the information requested constitutes a record as
defined in this Part, such requested records, if found, shall be made available
for inspection by the applicant, or the applicant shall be furnished with a
written acknowledgment of receipt of the application including the approximate
date when the application will be granted or denied. Records shall be made
available for inspection during regular office hours on regular working days at
the location or locations within the authority's facilities designated by the
secretary. If the requested records cannot be found after diligent search, the
secretary shall so certify if requested. If the application is denied, the
secretary shall so advise the applicant in writing, stating the reason therefor
and indicating the procedure available for appealing such denial as provided in
this Part. The secretary shall provide, if requested, copies of records to the
applicant therefor, together with his certification as to the correctness of
such copies, upon receipt of payment of the fees prescribed in this

Part. Notes
